alert.note: Alert for Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of northwestern Randolph and western Guilford Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near High Point, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding especially in urban areas, and poor drainage locations. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Archdale, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Climax, Lake Jeanette Marina, Oak Hollow Marina, Lake Brandt and Forest Oaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
